Dialogue.content: Hi, I'm Liam Patel. This is my first time meeting with a counselor.
Hello, Liam! It's nice to meet you. How are you feeling today?
I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed. I just started the new semester.
That's completely understandable. Starting a new semester can bring a lot of pressure. What's been concerning you?
I've received my syllabus and it looks like I have a lot of projects and assignments coming up. It's stressing me out.
It's common to feel anxious when faced with a heavy workload. Have you had a chance to talk to anyone about your feelings?
I mentioned it to my mom during dinner, but I still feel a lot of pressure to keep my grades up to maintain my scholarship.
Hi, I'm back. Things haven't gotten any easier.
Welcome back, Liam! I'm here to listen. What's going on?
I'm struggling with time management. I felt really intimidated in a group project, and I found it hard to speak up.
It sounds frustrating to deal with such pressure in group dynamics. Can you tell me more about what happened?
There's a classmate, Sarah, who tends to dominate discussions. I got so nervous that I just didn't contribute.
That can be really tough. Have you thought about ways to assert yourself in group settings?
I guess I could try preparing my ideas in advance, but it's just hard to break through the anxiety.
Hi again. I've been feeling pretty lonely lately.
Hi Liam! I appreciate you coming back in. What's been on your mind?
With midterms coming up, I feel pressure, and I've been declining invites to hang out. I miss hanging out with my friends and family.
It's common to isolate yourself during stressful times, but connection is important, too. How did you feel when your sister Aanya invited you to an event recently?
I told her I was too busy. I feel guilty for missing out on family time and worry they think I don't care.
It's understandable to feel that way. It's okay to communicate your struggles to them. Your family wants to support you.
Hey, I took a big step and talked to my advisor this week.
That's amazing, Liam! How did that go?
I opened up about my anxiety and struggles with my confidence in group settings.
I'm glad you felt comfortable sharing that. What advice did they give you?
They encouraged me to embrace my creativity and to look for small ways to contribute during group discussions.
That sounds very encouraging! How do you feel about implementing their advice?
I feel hopeful. I think I can slowly start reconnecting with my friends and try to express my ideas more.
That's a great plan! Remember, it's about progress, not perfection. If you need support, I'm here for you.
